repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
This pr emerges and continues the work form #4398
This pr introduces new shell syntax and should not change any logic in the file

comment_data.body: `2.7` -> `2.7*` a minor change that I forget to do the last time, doesn't matter that much, so I think we can just ignore that
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -50,51 +50,51 @@ echo "===================="
 echo "|VERSIONS INSTALLED|"
 echo "===================="
 echo "Python $PYTHON_SYS_VERSION"
-if [ "$CC" ]; then
+if [[ $CC ]]; then
   which ${CC%% *}
   ${CC%% *} --version
 fi
-if [ "$CXX" ]; then
+if [[ $CXX ]]; then
   which ${CXX%% *}
   ${CXX%% *} --version
 fi
 echo "===================="
 
 # Install python requirements
 echo "Installing requirements [python]"
-if [ -z "${PYTHON_VERSION##2.7}" ]; then
+if [[ $PYTHON_VERSION == "2.7"* ]]; then

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

milestone.description:
Goals:
 New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
 Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3`.
 Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
 Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Introduce new shell syntax for ci-run.sh
